channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Zelenskyy asks for Pope Leo XIV's help in bringing Ukrainian children home from Russia
item.description: Pope Leo XIV and Ukraine's President Zelenskyy spoke by phone recently, according to the Vatican.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Leo XIV and Ukraine's President Zelenskyy spoke by phone recently, according to the Vatican.

(Image credit: Domenico Stinellis)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Burke

item.title: 3 Trump officials with ties to antisemitic extremists. And, Syria sanctions may lift
item.description: NPR has identified some Trump officials with ties to antisemitic extremists. And, why Trump's pledge to potentially lift sanctions on Syria is significant.
item.content:encoded:
NPR has identified some Trump officials with ties to antisemitic extremists. And, why Trump's pledge to potentially lift sanctions on Syria is significant.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump meets Syria's interim president after pledging to lift sanctions
item.description: Gulf states are keen to invest in Syria, which has important mineral and oil reserves, but had been prevented from doing so by U.S. sanctions. President Trump has now pledged to lift the restrictions.
item.content:encoded:
Gulf states are keen to invest in Syria, which has important mineral and oil reserves, but had been prevented from doing so by U.S. sanctions. President Trump has now pledged to lift the restrictions.

(Image credit: Saudi Royal Palace/AP)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Multiple Trump White House officials have ties to antisemitic extremists
item.description: NPR has identified three Trump administration officials with close ties to antisemitic extremists, including a prominent Holocaust denier.
item.content:encoded:
NPR has identified three Trump administration officials with close ties to antisemitic extremists, including a prominent Holocaust denier.

(Image credit: Zach D. Roberts)
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: Oklahoma education standards say students must identify 2020 election 'discrepancies'
item.description: New academic standards in Oklahoma call for the teaching of "discrepancies" in the 2020 election, continuing the spread of a false narrative years after it was first pushed by Trump and his allies.
item.content:encoded:
New academic standards in Oklahoma call for the teaching of "discrepancies" in the 2020 election, continuing the spread of a false narrative years after it was first pushed by Trump and his allies.

(Image credit: Sue Ogrocki)
item.dc:creator: Beth Wallis

item.title: Federal judge OKs use of Alien Enemies Act to deport Venezuelans
item.description: A federal judge says President Donald Trump can use the Alien Enemies Act to deport Venezuelan citizens who are shown to be members of the Tren de Aragua gang.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge says President Donald Trump can use the Alien Enemies Act to deport Venezuelan citizens who are shown to be members of the Tren de Aragua gang.

(Image credit: Cristian Hernandez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.S. egg prices fall for the first time in months but remain near record highs
item.description: The average price for a dozen Grade A eggs declined to $5.12 last month after reaching a record $6.23 in March. It was the first month-to-month drop in egg prices since October 2024.
item.content:encoded:
The average price for a dozen Grade A eggs declined to $5.12 last month after reaching a record $6.23 in March. It was the first month-to-month drop in egg prices since October 2024.

(Image credit: LM Otero)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: ESPN's new streaming app could replace cable for some but may end up costing them more
item.description: ESPN says its long-anticipated subscription plan will cost $29.99 a month. An analyst says that, combined with subscriptions to other stream services, could drive the cost up to the price of cable packages.
item.content:encoded:
ESPN says its long-anticipated subscription plan will cost $29.99 a month. An analyst says that, combined with subscriptions to other stream services, could drive the cost up to the price of cable packages.

(Image credit: Phelan M. Ebenhack)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: Rapper Tory Lanez is hospitalized after being stabbed in a California prison
item.description: The rapper's Instagram account says his lungs collapsed after he was stabbed 14 times, but he is "in good spirits." Lanez is serving a 10-year sentence for shooting Megan Thee Stallion in 2020.
item.content:encoded:
The rapper's Instagram account says his lungs collapsed after he was stabbed 14 times, but he is "in good spirits." Lanez is serving a 10-year sentence for shooting Megan Thee Stallion in 2020.

(Image credit: Scott Roth)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: The 'Oscar' of food prizes goes to a Brazilian who harnessed the power of bacteria
item.description: This year's $500,000 World Food Prize, for advances in agriculture and nutrition, goes to Mariangela Hungria, who boosted Brazil's farming revolution, turning the country into a soybean superpower.
item.content:encoded:
This year's $500,000 World Food Prize, for advances in agriculture and nutrition, goes to Mariangela Hungria, who boosted Brazil's farming revolution, turning the country into a soybean superpower.

(Image credit: Dado Galdieri/Bloomberg via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Dan Charles
